name: Exclusive DevOps Training
description: Join for exclusive access to premium tutorials, behind-the-scenes, and more. Elevate your skill set and acquire a skill that is on high demand today
headline: Master DevOps:Exclusive Training

whatToExpect.summary: Our collaborative team, alongside DevOps experts, has diligently designed this curriculum to ensure your readiness for employment upon program completion.
list: Automate and manage infrastructure using tools like Terraform and Ansible.
Build robust deployment workflows with Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions.
Master AWS/Azure/GCP and container orchestration with Kubernetes and Docker.
Implement logging, metrics, and alerts using Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK.

instructor.about: With years of experience in DevOps, cloud architecture, and automation, I am a passionate advocate for scalable, resilient, and efficient infrastructure.

contents.title: Lesson 1 (Week 1-2) - DevOps Fundamentals: Introduction to DevOps and its Importance.
lessons: Introduction to DevOps and its Importance

contents.title: Lesson 2 (Week 1-2): Introduction to Linux and useful commands for a DevOps Engineer: Setting up Prerequisites for Linux
lessons: Week 1-2: Introduction to Linux (file system, commands, permissions)
Week 3-4: Git fundamentals (version control, branching, merging)

contents.title: Lesson 3(Week 3): Scripting and Software Lifecycle
lessons: Overview of YAML and JSON as Serialization Formats. Understanding JSON (JavaScript Object Notation)

contents.title: Lesson 4 (Week 4): Source Code Management using git
lessons: Using Git in IDE and Git Server Administration

contents.title: Lesson 5 (Week5-8): CI/CD Pipeline with Jenkins, Maven, SonarQube, Nexus, Tomcat, and Nginx. Building and Deployment
lessons: Deployment through Tomcat and Loading with Nginx
Continuous Integration with Jenkins: Introduction to Continuous Integration

contents.title: Lesson 9 (Week 12 -16):Configuration Management with Ansible and Terraform
Lesson 10 (Week 17):Monitoring and Infrastructure Automation using Prometheus and Grafana
Lesson 12 (Week 18-20):Final Course Review, resume preparation, interview Prep, and Assessment

review: This DevOps course streamlined our deployments—now we ship code faster, with fewer outages!

name: Machine Learning and operations
description: This training program equips participants with the essential skills to streamline machine learning deployment, automation, and maintenance.
headline: MASTERING MLOPS - A practical guide to scalable machine learning development

instructor.about: With years of experience in MLOps and machine learning engineering, I am a passionate advocate for scalable, real-world AI solutions.

review: This course transformed how I deploy ML models—clear, practical, and packed with real-world insights!

whatToExpect.summary: Covering everything from model development to CI/CD pipelines and production monitoring, it provides a hands-on approach to implementing MLOps best practices. By the end of the course, you'll be ready to build, deploy, and manage ML models efficiently in real-world applications.
list: Hands-on MLOps best practices from model development to CI/CD pipelines and production monitoring.
Efficiently build, deploy, and manage ML models in real-world applications using MLOps principles.
Master MLOps tools and techniques for seamless model development, deployment, and maintenance.
End-to-end MLOps implementation, covering model training, deployment, CI/CD, and monitoring.

name: Data Engineering
description: Dive deep into user-centric design methods and advanced prototyping tools.
headline: Master Data Engineering:Exclusive Training

whatToExpect.summary: Our collaborative team, alongside Data Engineering experts, has diligently designed this curriculum to ensure your readiness for employment upon program completion.

instructor.about: With years of experience in Data Engineering, cloud architecture, and automation, I am a passionate advocate for scalable, resilient, and efficient infrastructure.

contents.title: Week 2: SQL
lessons: Mini-Project: Build Your First SQL Portfolio

contents.title: Week 3: Linux/Bash Scripting
lessons: Write Bash Scripts for Data Tasks
Mini-Project: Automate a simple ETL pipeline using Bash (e.g., extract files from a folder, cleanthem, and move them to an organized directory).

contents.title: Week 4: Data Engineering Basics
lessons: Mini-Project: Build an end-to-end pipeline to clean a dataset and load it into an SQLite database.

contents.title: Week 5: Big Data Tools
lessons: Mini-Project: Process a large dataset using PySpark and generate a summary report.

contents.title: Week 6: Workflow Orchestration
lessons: Mini-Project: Build and deploy an Airflow pipeline that ingests API data and loads it into adatabase.

contents.title: Week 7: Data Modeling and Advanced SQL
lessons: Mini-Project: Design a data warehouse schema and populate it with mock data.

contents.title: Week 8: Azure Cloud for Data Engineering
lessons: Mini-Project: Build a cloud-based ETL pipeline using Azure Data Factory and Blob Storage.

contents.title: Week 9: Databricks for Big Data Analytics
lessons: Mounting Azure Data Lake on Databricks
Mini-Project: Build an end-to-end data analysis solution

contents.title: Week 10: DevOps for Data Engineering
lessons: Mini-Project: Build and deploy a containerized ETL pipeline with a CI/CD process.

contents.title: Week 11–12: Capstone Project
lessons: Portfolio Presentation: Document and present the solution as a portfolio project.

review: I recently completed this Data Engineering course and found it incredibly valuable. The content was well-structured, covering essential topics like data pipelines, ETL processes, SQL, and cloud technologies. The hands-on projects helped reinforce the concepts and gave me practical experience with tools like Apache Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. I highly recommend this course to anyone looking to build a strong foundation in data engineering.
